about_me.des: My name is Clément Gaultier, I work as a PhD student in the PANAMA team mainly on solving acoustic and audio signal processing inverse problems. From November 2015 I have been working on declipping and denoising using analysis/synthesis sparse priors. I also work on binaural sound source localization with massive regressions machine learning techniques. Additionally, I am really interested in the auditory system and topics such as augmented hearing, speech enhancement or hearing protection.

projects.intro: Below are listed some of the projects I am working on. Click on the name to visit the associated webpage.
projects.spare: Spare (SParse Audio REstoration) is a research project aming at proposing a new modeling and algorithmic framework to tackle audio reconstruction issues like denoising and declipping.
projects.vast: VAST (The Virtual Acoustic Space Traveler) is a research project aming at providing tools for applications such as sound source localization or room absorption prediction, using virtually supervised learning.
projects.jsm: JSM (Journée Science et Musique) is a science popularization open day about science and music organized every year by the PANAMA team (IRISA research center, Rennes (France)).
projects.aspade: A-SPADE (Analysis SParse Audio DEclipper) is a research project that developped an audio declipping procedure using analysis sparse modeling priors.

career.intro: You will find below a short description of my last positions and academic degrees.
career.panama_des: I am currently working as a PhD student in the Panama team (a joint project team between Inria and CNRS). My main research interests are inverse problems in audio & acoustic signal processing.
career.southampton: Hearing and Balance Centre, ISVR - Southampton University (UK)
career.southampton_des: During this research stay, I studied auditory adaptation to noise for improved speech perception. The focus was finding noise characteristics and aclimatization time-scales for enhanced speech perception. For that purpose, I designed and conducted different listening experiments on 33 volunteers with normal hearing.
career.ensim_des: In November 2015, I graduated from ENSIM, an engineering school in 5 years under the authority of the French Ministry of Education and Research. I specialized in Acoustics, Vibrations, Sensors.
career.univ: University Master of Science (Research M.Sc in Acoustics)
career.univ_des: In November 2015, I also graduated from Le Mans Université, as I was following a double degree (Research M.Sc specialized in acoustics).
